name: harira fassia
ingredients: 400 g of tomato puree or 4 ripe tomatoes
60 g of vermicelli or orzo pasta
250 g of lamb leg cut into pieces
steps: Soak the chickpeas and lentils for 12 hours. Finely chop the onion.
Blend the coriander, onion, and celery together with a little water. Set aside a small bowl of chopped herbs for the end.
In a pot, melt the Smen and olive oil. Brown the meat and onion.
Add the salt, pepper, cinnamon, turmeric, saffron, and ginger, and mix.
Add the tomato puree and 1 tablespoon of tomato paste. Let simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the soaked chickpeas and lentils, along with the chopped herbs. Cover with 2.5 liters of hot water. Cook until the chickpeas are tender.
Dilute the cornstarch (thickener) in a little cold water. Slowly pour into the soup while stirring constantly until thickened.
Add the vermicelli and the remaining chopped fresh herbs. Cook the pasta. Serve hot with a wedge of lemon.
